intro: Camphora brongniartii, commonly known as the African camphor tree, is a large evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the樟科 (Lauraceae) family and is characterized by its aromatic, glossy, dark green leaves. The tree produces small, white flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits containing smooth, black seeds. Its bark and leaves contain essential oils, which have been used traditionally for their medicinal and aromatic properties. Camphora brongniartii is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
